title: Prabowo Says US, EU Remain ‘Very Important’ as Trump Ignites Trade War
body: Prabowo and European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen are among the world leaders that had received Trump’s tariff threat letters.

title: Prabowo Urges Stronger EU Investment as Landmark Free Trade Deal Nears Ratification
body: Indonesia remains only the EU’s 5th-largest trading partner and 5th-biggest recipient of foreign direct investment among ASEAN countries.

title: EU Grants Indonesia Multi-Entry Schengen Visa as Landmark Trade Deal Nears Completion
body: The multi-entry Schengen visa allows holders to travel freely across 29 European countries without undergoing border checks.

title: EU Chief: Indonesia-EU Trade Deal Sends Strong Signal on Predictable Partnerships
body: Both Indonesia and the EU are facing mounting trade pressures, including steep tariffs from the United States under President Donald Trump.

title: Prabowo Courts EU Leaders in Brussels to Finalize Zero-Tariff Trade Deal
body: Under CEPA, 80 percent of Indonesia’s exports to the EU are expected to enjoy zero tariffs within one to two years of implementation.

title: A Look at The Countries that Received Trump's Tariff Letters
body: Nearly every country has faced a minimum 10 percent levy on goods entering the US since April, on top of other levies on specific products.

title: Who’s on Trump’s Tariff Letter? 23 Countries Facing Higher Rates
body: Trump warns 23 countries of higher tariffs by Aug. 1 unless deals are reached, with rates ranging from 20 percent to 50 percent.

title: Lavrov Says ASEAN Shows Interest in Russia as US Tariffs Haunt Bloc
body: Russia says that Moscow's ties with ASEAN have started long before Trump's launched the tariff blitz.

title: ‘Trade Has Been Unfair’: Marco Rubio Defends Trump's Tariffs on ASEAN Nations
body: Marco Rubio says that many ASEAN economies will have better tariff rates compared to countries in other parts of the world.

title: Indonesia Turns to Brazil as Model for Bioethanol and Clean Energy Transition

title: Indonesian Minister Apologizes, Cancels Plan for Tiny Subsidized Homes

title: US Soybean Exporters Praise Indonesia for Avoiding Retaliatory Tariffs
body: According to USSEC data, the United States supplies up to 2.6 million tons of soybeans to Indonesia annually.

title: Trump's Tariffs A Wake-Up Call for Indonesia, Foreign Minister Says
body: Foreign Minister Sugiono says that Indonesia must build its economy as US President Donald Trump's tariff hikes loom.

title: Indonesia, Uganda Eye Greater Trade Amid Trump’s Tariff Whiplash
body: In the first five months of 2025, Indonesia-Uganda trade already hit $72 million, already surpassing 2024 numbers.

title: US Tariff Threatens 70,000 Textile Jobs in Indonesia
body: Indonesia’s textile industry may cut 50,000–70,000 jobs if the US enforces a 32% tariff, hitting exports that account for 40% of the sector.

title: X CEO Linda Yaccarino Resigns, But Why Is No One Surprised?
body: Linda Yaccarino has resigned as CEO of Elon Musk’s X after two turbulent years, leaving the platform grappling with ad challenges.

title: Bridge Collapse Triggers Ban on Coal Trucks in Indonesia’s Coal-Heavy Province
body: South Sumatra has banned coal trucks from a key bridge after a collapse, underscoring the strain Indonesia’s coal boom places on roads.

title: Healthcare to Logistics: Four IPOs Drive IDX Gains Past 7,000
body: Four companies debuted on the IDX, lifting the Jakarta index above 7,000, as investor appetite remains strong.
